ygData.subject: System advice (OT)
ygData.msgSnippet: Hmm... Well EV... if you want to upgrade your system you may be better off doing the processor and memory only at this point.  Question is: Do you know what
ygData.messageBody:
Hmm...

Well EV... if you want to upgrade your system you may be better off doing
the processor and memory only at this point. Question is:

Do you know what chipset is on your board? If it's an Intel BX-440 Chipset
it will support processors all the way up to the PIII - 1000 so you could
feasibly just upgrade your processor to a PIII and stick another 64mb of ram
in it.

Even if it's an older board, with all you've done to it already, you'd be
better off just getting a board, processor and another stick of 64mb ram.
It'll save you a ton of money over buying a whole new system when you only
really need a memory and processor upgrade.

----- Original Message -----
From: "Webber, Jessica" <webber@...>
To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
Sent: Wednesday, July 05, 2000 12:31 PM
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Newbie Bard needs hunting suggestions


> > > Something wrong with a PII 200 with 64 MB RAM? Heh heh.
> >
> >
> > Your best cost/benefit upgrade would be another 64meg of RAM,
> > that should
> > improve things a LOT.
> >
> > Tszaaz
>
> Yeah, I priced that out a while back and have been putting it off. I've
> already upgraded the modem (to a winmodem of all things! F1 /bonk), the
> hard drive (it's a bad sign when you have to delete Powerpoint to fit
> Everquest), the sound card, and countless drivers. I feel like I'm
sinking
> time and money into a junk car at this point. So my intention is to live
> with it for a while longer then splurge on a whole new unit.
>
> But anyway, that doesn't alter the fact that Blackburrow is laggier than
any
> other low level zone (except perhaps low-level RoK zones) and still seems
an
> odd choice for a bard to hunt in. Tszaaz, do you experience lag
ANYWHERE???
>
>
> Peace
> Evulia
